//Description LET'S GO Skip The corona pandemic has highlighted significant educational inequalities, where the shift to digital learning has left vulnerable groups, including people with migration or refugee backgrounds and non-native speakers, even further behind in terms of education. Limited access to digital technologies and a perceived closed education system will hinder their engagement in learning opportunities and societal participation. To address this issue, the SEEDS project proposes a combination of social and digital outreach, utilizing chatbots as a bridge between cultural mediators, social workers, and educational institutions. The project aims to create learning materials that can be accessed and tracked through a mobile device, via the chatbot system. The project promotes participatory action research and networked evaluation to identify appropriate contents and testing scenarios across Europe. Project funding: Erasmus+ Strategic Partnership Project duration: 2021-2023 Already an User? Login here. Create Account

Mcq Activity Match these statements to following answers. "One of the models for intercultural competence (Bennett) can be applied as a simple checklist of four steps, trying to move away from ethnocentrism towards an understanding some of the ways in which other cultures are similar to and different from our own. We emphasize adapting behavior in response to differing cultural contexts and reconciling cultural differences in order to learn or create value from cross-cultural interactions. "
Activity 2: What´s the comment about? The adjustment to an unfamiliar situation or culture can be hard. There is some time of uncertainty and, in some cases, anxiety. We need to deal with ambiguity and new norms, ways to communicate/ behave. Some people go through similar phases during that time of adjustment. Can you connect these people´s comment to the description of the stage they´re at? Match the above statements with the pictures Feedback

Previous E-LEARNING SEEDS is an E learning app which helps you to learn from your home and contents updated by the teachers regularly CHATBOT You can chat with our inbuilt chatbot to get desired subjects and exercises LEARNING STATISTICS User statistics is available in the student dashboard which display the overall percentage of the subjects already completed by the student Introduction video The Introduction video above displays a demo of functionality of the app Chat Funded by the European Union. Views and opinions expressed are however those of the author(s) only and do not necessarily reflect those of the European Union or the European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA). Neither the European Union nor EACEA can be held responsible for them. We take data privacy seriously and are committed to ensuring the protection and security of your information. This data privacy statement outlines how your data is collected, used, and stored when you use our mobile application for the research project.

1. Data Collection and Usage: We collect minimal data to create a user profile, including your selected username and password, as well as your device ID. This information is solely used to establish your user profile within the application and is not linked to any personally identifiable information. We do not collect any personal data such as name, address, contact details, or any other sensitive information.

2. Data Storage and Management: All collected data is securely stored and managed by our project team on servers located in Germany. We maintain strict measures to safeguard your data from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.

3. Research Purposes: The usage data collected from the application is used solely for research purposes related to the project. This data will be analyzed to gain insights into the application's functionality, user behavior, and overall performance.

4. Data Retention: We will retain the collected data for a period of one year after the project's completion. After this period, all data will be securely deleted, ensuring that it is no longer accessible or traceable.

5. Data Sharing: We do not share any user data with third parties, except as required by law or with your explicit consent. Our project team is the only entity with access to the data, and we adhere to strict confidentiality protocols.

6. Consent: By using our mobile application, you consent to the collection and usage of the limited data described in this statement. Your participation in the research project is entirely voluntary, and you may withdraw your consent at any time by discontinuing the use of the application.

7. Data Security: We employ industry-standard security measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, loss, alteration, or disclosure. However, please be aware that no method of data transmission over the internet or electronic storage is entirely secure, and while we strive to protect your data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

For any concerns or inquiries related to data privacy or this statement, please contact our project team at seeds.members@listserv.dfn.de.

This data privacy statement is subject to change, and any updates will be communicated to users through the mobile application or our project website. We recommend checking this statement periodically to stay informed about how your data is handled. Privacy Policy Statement / Terms of Use What is SEEDS?

SEEDS is a project that proposes a combination of social and digital outreach, utilizing chatbots as a bridge between cultural mediators, social workers, and educational institutions. The project aims to create an eco-system, where learning materials are created by educators through a web application, and then accessed and tracked by learners through a mobile device, via the chatbot system.

Who is funding SEEDS project?

SEEDS is funded by: Erasmus+ Strategic Partnership

What is the project's website?

You can visit us on: https://seeds.wineme.wiwi.uni-siegen.de

How can I contact the team?

You can contact us using our email: seeds.members@listserv.dfn.de

Who are the project partners?

SEEDS is a collaboration among 4 partners: 1) University of Siegen, Institute of Knowledge Based Systems and Knowledge Management. 2)University of Siegen, Chair of Information Systems and New Media. 3) University of Alicante. 4) Open Lab Athens

Is the project still running or finished?

The project's duration is two years, between Mar. 2021- Feb. 2023.

Are the outcomes of the project openly accessible?

All SEEDS project results are open-access and available on the project's website and repositories.

Where can I find the results of the project?

You can find the project's results and repository links on the project's website. What is SEEDS? Who is funding SEEDS project? What is the project's website? How can I contact the team?
